---
title: "Mobility Data"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
US_2020 <- read_csv("data/2020_US_Region_Mobility_Report.csv")
US_2021 <- read_csv("data/2021_US_Region_Mobility_Report.csv")
```

parks, transit, retail & recreation

California: 

```{r}
cali_take2 <- US_2020 %>% 
  select(sub_region_1, 
         iso_3166_2_code, 
         date, 
         retail_and_recreation_percent_change_from_baseline, 
         transit_stations_percent_change_from_baseline) %>% 
  filter(iso_3166_2_code == "US-CA", date > "2020-09-01")

cali_take2

cali_take2 %>% ggplot(aes(x = date, y = transit_stations_percent_change_from_baseline)) + geom_line() + theme_linedraw()+ labs(title = "Transit Data California", subtitle = "September 1 2020 - December 31 2020", x = "Date", y = "Transit Percent Change from Baseline")
cali_take2 %>% ggplot(aes(x = date, y = retail_and_recreation_percent_change_from_baseline)) + geom_line() + theme_linedraw()

cali_2021_take2 <- US_2021 %>% 
  select(sub_region_1, 
         iso_3166_2_code, 
         date, 
         retail_and_recreation_percent_change_from_baseline, 
         transit_stations_percent_change_from_baseline) %>% 
  filter(iso_3166_2_code == "US-CA")

cali_2021_take2

cali_2021_take2 %>% ggplot(aes(x = date, y = transit_stations_percent_change_from_baseline)) + geom_line() + theme_linedraw() 
cali_2021_take2 %>% ggplot(aes(x = date, y = retail_and_recreation_percent_change_from_baseline)) + geom_line() + theme_linedraw()
```
